description: This file defines a React component called ErrorBoundary, which provides a fallback UI for handling runtime errors in a React application. It prevents a blank screen by displaying an error message when an uncaught exception occurs during rendering or lifecycle hooks.

classes.name: ErrorBoundary
classes.description: A React component that catches JavaScript errors anywhere in its child component tree, logs those errors, and displays a fallback UI instead of the component tree that crashed.

methods.name: getDerivedStateFromError
methods.description: A static lifecycle method that updates the state to indicate an error has occurred and captures the error message.

methods.name: componentDidCatch
methods.description: A lifecycle method for logging error details to an external service or console when an error is caught.

methods.name: render
methods.description: Returns the fallback UI when an error has been caught, otherwise renders child components.
